    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Formula(java.lang.String formulaName, java.lang.String formulaDesc, java.lang.String formulaId, java.lang.String formulaEquation)
      Constructor for Formula class Sets values for object fields, establishes an exp4j compatible expression using the base equation given, and sets up a Double array based off of the base equation given for storing input variable object values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Formula

        public Formula(java.lang.String formulaName,
               java.lang.String formulaDesc,
               java.lang.String formulaId,
               java.lang.String formulaEquation)
        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Constructor for Formula class Sets values for object fields, establishes an exp4j compatible expression using the base equation given, and sets up a Double array based off of the base equation given for storing input variable object values.
        Parameters:
        formulaName - A formula's name, taken from _formulaName
        formulaDesc - A formula's description, taken from _formulaDesc
        formulaId - A formula's id, taken from _formulaId
        formulaEquation - A formula's equation, taken from _formulaEquation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If validation of the exp4j expression is unsuccessful.

      • _buildExpression

        private net.objecthunter.exp4j.Expression _buildExpression()
        A method to build an exp4j expression for a formula object, given that a valid formula equation was input by the configuration file.
        Returns:
        An Exp4j Expression object for use in calculating formulas (Expression).

      • _calculateExpression

        private double _calculateExpression(IVariable<? extends java.lang.Number>[] vars)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the double result of calculating the Formula object's Exp4j Expression.
        Parameters:
        vars - The Variable objects with the desired input values in array format.
        Returns:
        The result of calculating the Formula object's Expression (double).
        Throws:
        InvalidNumberOfArgumentsException - If the variable object array given does not have the correct amount of elements.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the incoming array is the wrong size, or if values in the array cannot be parsed into a numerical value.

      • _process

        private double _process()
        Sets the Exp4j Expression variables to the proper values from the temporary input array, validates the Expression, then returns the result of evaluating the expression.
        Returns:
        The result of evaluating the Formula object's Exp4j Expression, in double format.
